title: Indian Premier League 2017: Virat Kohli's RCB snare exciting fast bowler Tymal Mills : Cricket, News - India Today
text:
Mills is one of the most exciting young pacers in the shortest format today 2 In four T20Is so far, he has picked three wickets and has a decent economy rate of 7.25 3 Starc's decision to part ways with RCB prompted them to go aggressively for Mills 
Mitchell Starc's decision to part ways with Royal Challengers Bangalore prompted the franchise to go aggressively for England pacer Tymal Mills in Monday's Indian Premier League player auction on Monday. 
RCB finished second last year but they missed the services of Starc, who was out for the entire season due to an injury. This time, the Australian pace spearead pulled out of the IPL, leaving a big void in the team. 
The Royal Challengers undoubtedly, have the most daunting batting line-up with the likes of Chris Gayle , Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers, Shane Watson, Lokesh Rahul and Kedar Jadhav. 
All they needed was an explosive pacer and RCB spared no effort in signing on Mills, who is one of the most exciting young pacers in the shortest format today. 
In four T20 Internationals so far, he has picked three wickets and has a decent economy rate of 7.25. At 24, he is very experienced in T20 cricket, having played 55 matches over four years. 
RCB coach Daniel Vettori said his team needed something different and exceptional to succeed and hence their aggressive bid for Mills.
